trans-unit.source: Represents a title for the entire chart image.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> class encapsulates all the functionality of a title for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.

This class is exposed using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Titles%2A> collection property of the root <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object.
There can be any number of titles for an entire chart image.
Titles are able to:
Be docked and aligned or custom-positioned.
Be displayed inside or outside the plotted chart areas.

Use a predefined <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle> such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Embed> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Shadow>.
Use hatching, gradient colors and background images.
Be sized and positioned anywhere within the chart image.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> class with the specified title text.
The text for the title.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> class with the specified title text and docking value.
The text for the title.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Docking"></xref> enumeration value that determines where the title will be docked on the chart.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> class with the specified title text, docking value, font and color.
The text for the title.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Docking"></xref> enumeration value that determines where the title will be docked on the chart.
The title font.
The title color.
Gets or sets the alignment of the title.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Alignment%2A> property has no effect on alignment if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment"></xref> enumeration value that represents the title alignment within the text drawing area.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.ContentAlignment.MiddleCenter"></xref>.
Gets or sets the background color of the title.
You can set this property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> value will be the first color used if you have specified gradient colors for the background.
The alpha value controls the opacity of a color.
If you set this color to "transparent"—that is, if you use an alpha value of 0—no color will be assigned to the background of the title.
As a result, the background will be transparent.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that represents the background color of the title.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.White"></xref>.
Gets or sets the orientation for the background gradient of a title.
Also determines whether a gradient is used.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to determine whether a title will display a gradient, and to determine the orientation of the gradient if one is used.
For a listing of available patterns, refer to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle> enumeration.
To use gradient colors:
Set the primary color of the title background with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color of the title background with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle"></xref> enumeration that represents the orientation for the background gradient of a title.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets the hatching style for the title.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration specifies the hatch pattern used by a brush of type <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.HatchBrush>.
The hatch pattern consists of a solid background color and lines drawn over the background.
For a listing of available hatching styles, refer to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration.
**Note** The color of hatching lines is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle"></xref> enumeration that specifies the hatching style for the title.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets the background image of the title.
This property defines a path to a background image for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> title, and can be an absolute or relative URL.

To position the image, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> properties.
You can also specify one of the colors displayed by the image as "transparent", by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageTransparentColor%2A> property.
An image be any valid graphics file supported by .NET Framework, including icons.
Background images take precedence over other background properties such as gradient color.
A `string` value that represents the URL of an image file.
The default is an empty string.
Gets or sets the alignment of the title background image.

This property is used when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageAlignmentStyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the alignment of the title background image.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageAlignmentStyle.TopLeft"></xref>.
Gets or sets a color that will be drawn as transparent when the background image is drawn.
This color will be displayed as transparent when the chart is rendered.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that specifies the color that will be drawn as transparent when the background image is drawn.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the drawing mode for the background image of the title.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property determines how the image is displayed; the image can be tiled, scaled, and so forth.
If an image is scaled, it will be stretched to fit within the bounds of the title.
If the image is tiled, it is repeatedly drawn, starting from the top-left corner of the title.
For more information about the available wrapping modes, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode> enumeration topic.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled>, the location where the image is drawn is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackImageAlignment%2A> property setting.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the drawing mode for the background image of the title.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Tile"></xref>.
Gets or sets the secondary color of the title background.

This <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property is one of several related properties that determine the secondary background color of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> objects, and is used when gradient colors are being applied.
You can set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
If hatching is used, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the color of the hatching lines for the title.
To use gradient colors for the background of a title:
Set the primary color with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value used for the secondary color of a background with hatching or gradient fill.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the border color of the title.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BorderColor%2A> property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that specifies the border color of the title.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the border style of the title.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.BorderDashStyle%2A> property determines the line style to use for a border.
The line can be solid, dotted, and so forth.
For other border styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle> enumeration topic.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle"></xref> enumeration value that determines the border style of the title.
Gets or sets the border width of the title.
An `integer` value that determines the border width, in pixels, of the title.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> where the title will be docked.
A `string` value that represents the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> where this title will be docked.
The default value is the empty string.
Gets or sets a value that determines where the title is docked.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> can be docked to the top, left, bottom or right of either the entire chart image, or the inside or outside of a chart area.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `false`, docking applies to the entire chart image.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `true`, docking applies to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> property

This property has no effect if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is not set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Docking"></xref> enumeration value that determines where the title is docked.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Docking.Top"></xref>.
Gets or sets the positive or negative offset of the docked title position.
An `integer` value that specifies the positive or negative offset of the docked title position.
Gets or sets the font for the title.
Use a new <xref:System.Drawing.Font> object when setting this property.
Assign the entire object to the property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> object that represents the font for the title.
Defaults to "Microsoft Sans Serif, 8pt".
Gets or sets the color of the title text.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.ForeColor%2A> property is used to set the title text color.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that is used to draw the color of the title text .
Gets or sets a flag that specifies whether the title should be docked within a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> object.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property is set to `false`, the title is docked to the outside edge of the plotted chart areas; if this property is set to `true`, the title will be docked to the inside edge of the chart area.

This property will have no effect if the name of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object is not assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> property.

**Note** This behavior only applies if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto%2A>.

If this is not the case, setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property has no effect, because the position of the title is then determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property value.
`true` if the title will be docked within a chart area; `false` if the title will be docked outside the chart area.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the unique name of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> object.
The name of a title object must be unique; otherwise an exception will be thrown.

This property can be used as the indexer when you retrieve a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> object from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TitleCollection> object.
If this property is set to a zero-length string, an exception will be thrown.
A `string` value that represents the unique name of the title object.
Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition"></xref> object, which can be used to get or set the position of the title.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Position%2A> property is automatic (that is, Title.Position.Auto = `true`) the title position is calculated automatically by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control, taking into account the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Alignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> property settings.

If it is not automatic, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.Docking%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.DockedToChartArea%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.IsDockedInsideChartArea%2A> properties are ignored, and the title position is solely determined by the value of the returned <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition> object.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition"></xref> value that represents the position of the title.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ElementPosition.Auto"></xref>.
Gets or sets the shadow color for the title.
This property can be set to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The alpha value can be used to achieve a "realistic" shadowing effect; try a color value of "128,0,0,0" for shadows.
To implement a shadow, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title.ShadowOffset%2A> property to a value other than zero (0).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that specifies the shadow color for the title.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Black"></xref>.
Gets or sets the shadow offset, in pixels, of the title.
To implement shadowing, set this property to a value other than zero (0).
A positive value will result in a shadow that shifts down and to the right; a negative value will result in a shadow that shifts up and to the left.
An `integer` value that represents the shadow offset, in pixels, of the title.
Gets or sets the text for the title.
A `string` value that represents the text for the title.
Gets or sets the orientation of the text in the title.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextOrientation"></xref> enumeration value that determines the orientation of the text in the title.
Gets or sets the style of the text for the title.

There are five possible styles for title text: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Default>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Shadow>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Emboss>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Embed>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Frame>.
Refer to the table below for a summary of these styles:
Style
Description
Default
Text is displayed using the desired font and color, with no additional effects.
Shadow
Text is displayed using the desired font and color with an added shadow effect on the text.
Emboss
Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn with an embossing effect.
Embed
Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn with an embedding effect.
Frame
Text is displayed using the desired font and color but drawn as an outline of the text, that is, with no fill.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle"></xref> enumeration value that determines the style of the text for the title.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextStyle.Default"></xref>.
Gets or sets the tooltip for the title.
A `string` value that represents the tooltip for the title.
Gets or sets the visibility flag of the title.
`true` if the title is visible; otherwise, `false`.
